en.title: The Stolen Sapphire
en.invitation: Mr. Holmes, the 'Star of Midnight' sapphire has been stolen from the Countess of Morcar during her annual ball. I implore you to attend at once. The culprit is still among the guests!
en.description: A grand ballroom is in disarray. Guests whisper in hushed tones while police secure the area. The famous 'Star of Midnight' sapphire is gone.

suspects.name: LordAshworth
suspects.statement: I was speaking with the ambassador all evening. A terrible affair!
suspects.clue: His tie pin is identical to one found near the display case.

suspects.name: MademoiselleDupont
suspects.statement: I never left the dance floor. The sapphire was exquisite, non?
suspects.clue: A single, long red hair was found on the velvet pedestal.

roomDetails.name: Ballroom
roomDetails.description: The grand ballroom is a scene of chaos. A display case in the center of the room is shattered.

roomDetails.name: Terrace
roomDetails.description: The cold night air bites at you on the stone terrace. An ornate railing overlooks the gardens.

objectDetails.name: shattered_glass
objectDetails.description: Shards of thick glass litter the floor around a velvet pedestal.
objectDetails.examine: The glass was broken from the inside, as if by a sudden pressure.
objectDetails.deduce: The thief didn't break the glass from the outside; they must have had a key.

objectDetails.name: cigar_stub
objectDetails.description: A half-smoked cigar lies extinguished on the stone floor.
objectDetails.examine: It's a rare brand, imported from Cuba. Only a connoisseur would smoke this.
objectDetails.deduce: Lord Ashworth is known for his love of expensive Cuban cigars.

questions.question_prompt: Based on the evidence, the thief must have had ______ and is likely ____.

watsonHints: Consider how the glass was broken.
Who had the means and opportunity?
en.winning_message: Outstanding! You've answered all questions correctly and solved the case perfectly.
